User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20111008085652

Steps to reproduce:

While running Litmus testcase ID# 14065 (Search Messages), I tried to consecutively re-sort the search results by different columns.


Actual results:

The column sorting indicator in one column didn't disappear, after another column to sort by was selected. It was possible to have column sorting indicators in all visible columns, even though the sort order was only determined by the last selected column.
I observed the redundant sort indicators to disappear when moving the mouse back and hovering over a column header with an invalid sort indicator. Also, all but the active sort indicator disappeared when giving focus to another application window (I tried to take a screen-shot to clarify this issue, but couldn't capture the faulty behaviour, as all invalid sort indicators disappeared when launching the screen-shot application.). Also, the subject column (first column) doesn't seem to be affected by this problem, as it clears all invalid sort indicators when selected as the column to sort by (as would be expected in all other cases as well).


Expected results:

I would expect only one sort indicator to be shown at a given time, corresponding to the column that is actually used to sort the search results.

comments.text:
> … on Linux

Not limited to Linux. 

Also reproducible with KDE Plasma 5 on FreeBSD-CURRENT with: 

- Waterfox, where I first realised the bug

- Firefox.

----

Likely explanations for people _not_ realising this bug 703849 include Mozilla bug: 

1293983 - Sort direction arrow in tree column headers is upside-down
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1293983

– if people (like me) learn to completely ignore the arrow, they're likely to also _not_ notice when the arrow fails to change its upside-down direction. 

I guess that it's related to GTK+

----

$ date ; uname -v
Tue 29 May 2018 13:14:29 BST
FreeBSD 12.0-CURRENT #2 r333587: Mon May 14 01:59:02 BST 2018     root@momh167-gjp4-hpelitebook8570p-freebsd:/usr/obj/usr/src/amd64.amd64/sys/GENERIC 
$ pkg info waterfox | grep Version
Version        : 56.2.0.13_5
$ pkg info firefox | grep Version
Version        : 60.0.1_3,1
